intro: Wrightia rubriflora, commonly known as the red-flowered wrightia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Wrightiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pinkish-red. Wrightia rubriflora typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
